Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: I have to say, I enjoyed every single bite of the meal in (Indian Restaurant Kamasutra Amsterdam ). I had a course meal, with a couple of soft drinks. Considering the quality, the price is reasonable as compared to expensive Amsterdam. ‚Ä¶

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Great food, served very swiftly. Mild by general UK curry standards, extremely tasty. A definite recommendation for a curry in central Amsterdam. They also do takeaway/delivery.

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Friendly staff and incredible food, Kamasutra is a place you must visit for authentic Indian food. The curries come with rice and the portions are quite generous. The also have an amazing selection of gins from India.

Name: Kama Sutra

Review Text: It was very cold in the restaurant and the worst was that they were leaving the entrance door open while there were -1¬∞c outside. They did not take our order right and the waiting time was very long. The food was good but I could not enjoy it in these conditions.

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Amazing preset menus for two people with the most popular dishes. The food was warm, delicious and the portions were perfectly sized for two! We finished every bite! Delicious

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: As far as Indian food goes, this place is pretty damn decent. The food was good and pretty authentic. I went with the recommendation from the waiter and I do enjoy spicy food. Restaurant did not disappoint.

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Kamasutra is my #1 spot for Indian food in central Amsterdam. I order from here on a regular basis; the food is delicious and the prices are reasonable. I usually order food to be delivered from here, but I dine in on occasion as well. The ‚Ä¶

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Nice Indian restaurant with friendly service. We ordered the preselected special for two for ‚Ç¨32 and it was excellent.  It came with two proteins, rice, curry, salad and naan. We were glad we stopped by!

Name: Kama Sutra

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Great indian food delivered fast every time.. We are 3 people in the house and we ordered from many other indian restaurants. Name: Kama Sutra

Name: Kama Sutra

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Truly excellent  experience overall. Seated right away at a table of my choosing. Ordered the Chicken Tika Masala and Garlic Naan.  The food arrived fresh, hot, and in a timely fashion. Top-notch service all night by Sandy (sp?). Some great Indian food at a reasonable price. Well done!

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: We ordered some tikka masala & butter. The flavors were absolutely intensive. Enjoyed the food all the way. Maybe the best indian cousene I've ever had. Staff was wery kind and helpful. Thank you.

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: We ordered for office and people were very kind to adjust their schedule for us. They open at 2:00 pm but they arranged for us at 12:30. ‚Ä¶

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Great & delicious indian food restaurant in busy area of Amsterdam central.Also here you can get Indonesian food. Not a proper indian restaurant but i bet you wont regret the taste. Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Great service, great food. We had a shared platter of veggie dishes as well as meat dishes . Everything was very delicious and prepared super quick. This way we were able to try a lot of dishes.

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: The best restaurant in town. Simple and efficient. He is worth his money. The wine list is interesting and inexpensive. The service is attentive and very discreet. It's nice to eat here.

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Very good quality Indian food.  The tandoori chicken was our favorite. Lentils are spicy which was great.  Servers were friendly.  Get the seat in the window if you can.

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Best indian in Amsterdam. New owners but same chef. Table in window is best seat in the house. Watching the street action and good fresh food.  Perfect

Name: Kama Sutra
Review Text: Pretty mediocre Indian fair served in a clean but otherwise plain setting.  The service is a little brusque but the food is reasonably priced.  Overall, if you're in a jam and craving Indian food, this will do but otherwise give it a miss.  There are better places to eat in Amsterdam.
